trans-unit.source: Use visual feedback to show users when their interactions with a Windows Store app are detected, interpreted, and handled.
trans-unit.target: Use visual feedback to show users when their interactions with a Windows Store app are detected, interpreted, and handled.

trans-unit.source: Visual feedback
trans-unit.target: Visual feedback

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for visual feedback
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for visual feedback

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Use visual feedback to show users when their interactions are detected, interpreted, and handled.
trans-unit.target: Use visual feedback to show users when their interactions are detected, interpreted, and handled.

trans-unit.source: Visual feedback can help users by encouraging interaction.
trans-unit.target: Visual feedback can help users by encouraging interaction.

trans-unit.source: It indicates the success of an interaction, which improves the user's sense of control.
trans-unit.target: It indicates the success of an interaction, which improves the user's sense of control.

trans-unit.source: It also relays system status and reduces errors.
trans-unit.target: It also relays system status and reduces errors.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.Devices.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.Devices.Input

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Input
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Input

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Core
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Core

trans-unit.source: Dos and don'ts
trans-unit.target: Dos and don'ts

trans-unit.source: Provide visual feedback no matter how brief the contact.
trans-unit.target: Provide visual feedback no matter how brief the contact.

trans-unit.source: This helps the user to:
trans-unit.target: This helps the user to:

trans-unit.source: Confirm that the touch screen is working.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that the touch screen is working.

trans-unit.source: Identify whether the target is touch-enabled or responsive.
trans-unit.target: Identify whether the target is touch-enabled or responsive.

trans-unit.source: Identify whether the user missed their intended target.
trans-unit.target: Identify whether the user missed their intended target.

trans-unit.source: Display feedback immediately for all interaction events.
trans-unit.target: Display feedback immediately for all interaction events.

trans-unit.source: Provide feedback that consists of subtle, intuitive cues that don't distract users.
trans-unit.target: Provide feedback that consists of subtle, intuitive cues that don't distract users.

trans-unit.source: Ensure touch targets stick to the fingertip during all manipulations.
trans-unit.target: Ensure touch targets stick to the fingertip during all manipulations.

trans-unit.source: Enable selection of items with the swipe gesture when panning is constrained to one direction.
trans-unit.target: Enable selection of items with the swipe gesture when panning is constrained to one direction.

trans-unit.source: Don't use touch visualizations in situations where they might interfere with the use of the app.
trans-unit.target: Don't use touch visualizations in situations where they might interfere with the use of the app.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [**ShowGestureFeedback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241969).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [**ShowGestureFeedback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241969).

trans-unit.source: Don't display feedback unless it is absolutely necessary.
trans-unit.target: Don't display feedback unless it is absolutely necessary.

trans-unit.source: Keep the UI clean and uncluttered by not showing visual feedback unless you are adding value that is not available elsewhere.
trans-unit.target: Keep the UI clean and uncluttered by not showing visual feedback unless you are adding value that is not available elsewhere.

trans-unit.source: Never display tooltips if they repeat text that is already visible.
trans-unit.target: Never display tooltips if they repeat text that is already visible.

trans-unit.source: Tooltips should be reserved for specific occasions, such as truncated text (text with ellipsis) that is not displayed when the item is selected, or where additional information is required to understand or use your app.
trans-unit.target: Tooltips should be reserved for specific occasions, such as truncated text (text with ellipsis) that is not displayed when the item is selected, or where additional information is required to understand or use your app.

trans-unit.source: Don't use the press and hold gesture for anything other than informational UI.
trans-unit.target: Don't use the press and hold gesture for anything other than informational UI.

trans-unit.source: **Important** Press and hold can be used for selection in cases where both horizontal and vertical panning is enabled.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Press and hold can be used for selection in cases where both horizontal and vertical panning is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Don't customize the visual feedback behaviors of the built-in Windows 8 gestures, as this can create an inconsistent and confusing user experience.
trans-unit.target: Don't customize the visual feedback behaviors of the built-in Windows 8 gestures, as this can create an inconsistent and confusing user experience.

trans-unit.source: Don't show visual feedback during panning or dragging; the actual movement of the object on the screen is sufficient.
trans-unit.target: Don't show visual feedback during panning or dragging; the actual movement of the object on the screen is sufficient.

trans-unit.source: But if the content area doesn't pan or scroll, then use visualizations to indicate the boundary conditions.
trans-unit.target: But if the content area doesn't pan or scroll, then use visualizations to indicate the boundary conditions.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Guidelines for panning](guidelines-for-panning.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Guidelines for panning](guidelines-for-panning.md).

trans-unit.source: Don't display feedback for a control that isn't identified as the target.
trans-unit.target: Don't display feedback for a control that isn't identified as the target.

trans-unit.source: Visual feedback is critical when relying on touch input for activities that require accuracy and precision based on location.
trans-unit.target: Visual feedback is critical when relying on touch input for activities that require accuracy and precision based on location.

trans-unit.source: Displaying feedback every time you detect touch input helps the user understand any custom targeting heuristics defined by your app and its controls.
trans-unit.target: Displaying feedback every time you detect touch input helps the user understand any custom targeting heuristics defined by your app and its controls.

trans-unit.source: Don't use feedback behavior intended for one input type with another.
trans-unit.target: Don't use feedback behavior intended for one input type with another.

trans-unit.source: For example, a keyboard focus rectangle should be used only with keyboard input, not touch.
trans-unit.target: For example, a keyboard focus rectangle should be used only with keyboard input, not touch.

trans-unit.source: Additional usage guidance
trans-unit.target: Additional usage guidance

trans-unit.source: Contact visualizations are especially critical for touch interactions that require accuracy and precision.
trans-unit.target: Contact visualizations are especially critical for touch interactions that require accuracy and precision.

trans-unit.source: For example, your app should clearly indicate the location of a tap to let a user know if they missed their target, how much they missed it by, and what adjustments they must make.
trans-unit.target: For example, your app should clearly indicate the location of a tap to let a user know if they missed their target, how much they missed it by, and what adjustments they must make.

trans-unit.source: Use the platform controls exposed through the Windows Store apps language frameworks (Windows Store apps using JavaScript and Windows Store apps using C++, C#, or Visual Basic) to get Windows 8 visualizations for free.
trans-unit.target: Use the platform controls exposed through the Windows Store apps language frameworks (Windows Store apps using JavaScript and Windows Store apps using C++, C#, or Visual Basic) to get Windows 8 visualizations for free.

trans-unit.source: If your app features custom interactions that require customized feedback, you should ensure the feedback is appropriate, spans input devices, and doesn't distract a user from their task.
trans-unit.target: If your app features custom interactions that require customized feedback, you should ensure the feedback is appropriate, spans input devices, and doesn't distract a user from their task.

trans-unit.source: This can be a particular issue in game or drawing apps, where the visual feedback might conflict with or obscure critical UI.
trans-unit.target: This can be a particular issue in game or drawing apps, where the visual feedback might conflict with or obscure critical UI.

trans-unit.source: Important
trans-unit.target: Important

trans-unit.source: We don't recommend changing the interaction behavior of the built-in gestures.
trans-unit.target: We don't recommend changing the interaction behavior of the built-in gestures.

trans-unit.source: Feedback UI
trans-unit.target: Feedback UI

trans-unit.source: Feedback UI is generally dependent on the input device (touch, touchpad, mouse, pen/stylus, keyboard, and so on).
trans-unit.target: Feedback UI is generally dependent on the input device (touch, touchpad, mouse, pen/stylus, keyboard, and so on).

trans-unit.source: For example, the built-in feedback for a mouse usually involves moving and changing the cursor, while touch and pen require contact visualizations, and keyboard input and navigation uses focus rectangles and highlighting.
trans-unit.target: For example, the built-in feedback for a mouse usually involves moving and changing the cursor, while touch and pen require contact visualizations, and keyboard input and navigation uses focus rectangles and highlighting.

trans-unit.source: Use [**ShowGestureFeedback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241969) to set feedback behavior for the platform gestures.
trans-unit.target: Use [**ShowGestureFeedback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241969) to set feedback behavior for the platform gestures.

trans-unit.source: If customizing feedback UI, ensure you provide feedback that supports, and is suitable for, all input modes.
trans-unit.target: If customizing feedback UI, ensure you provide feedback that supports, and is suitable for, all input modes.

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples of built-in contact visualizations in Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples of built-in contact visualizations in Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: Touch visualization
trans-unit.target: Touch visualization

trans-unit.source: Mouse/touchpad visualization
trans-unit.target: Mouse/touchpad visualization

trans-unit.source: Pen visualization
trans-unit.target: Pen visualization

trans-unit.source: Keyboard visualization
trans-unit.target: Keyboard visualization

trans-unit.source: Informational UI (popups)
trans-unit.target: Informational UI (popups)

trans-unit.source: One of the primary forms of visual feedback is informational UI (or disambiguation UI).
trans-unit.target: One of the primary forms of visual feedback is informational UI (or disambiguation UI).

trans-unit.source: Informational UI identifies and displays info about an object, describes functionality and how to access it, and provides guidance where necessary.
trans-unit.target: Informational UI identifies and displays info about an object, describes functionality and how to access it, and provides guidance where necessary.

trans-unit.source: Here are the different types of informational UI supported by Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: Here are the different types of informational UI supported by Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: Tooltips
trans-unit.target: Tooltips

trans-unit.source: Rich tooltips
trans-unit.target: Rich tooltips

trans-unit.source: Menus
trans-unit.target: Menus

trans-unit.source: Message dialogs
trans-unit.target: Message dialogs

trans-unit.source: Flyouts
trans-unit.target: Flyouts

trans-unit.source: Informational UI is particularly useful for overcoming fingertip occlusion (obstruction) and improving touch interactions with your app.
trans-unit.target: Informational UI is particularly useful for overcoming fingertip occlusion (obstruction) and improving touch interactions with your app.

trans-unit.source: It even has a built-in gesture dedicated to it: press and hold.
trans-unit.target: It even has a built-in gesture dedicated to it: press and hold.

trans-unit.source: Press and hold is a timed interaction, which are typically discouraged in Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: Press and hold is a timed interaction, which are typically discouraged in Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: A timed interaction is acceptable in this case as it is used as a tool for learning and exploration.
trans-unit.target: A timed interaction is acceptable in this case as it is used as a tool for learning and exploration.

trans-unit.source: The recommended length of time depends on the type of informational UI.
trans-unit.target: The recommended length of time depends on the type of informational UI.

trans-unit.source: Here are the recommended time thresholds.
trans-unit.target: Here are the recommended time thresholds.

trans-unit.source: Informational UI type Timing Activation Usage Occlusion tooltip (for scrubbing and small targets) 0 ms Yes For rapid clarification of actions.
trans-unit.target: Informational UI type Timing Activation Usage Occlusion tooltip (for scrubbing and small targets) 0 ms Yes For rapid clarification of actions.

trans-unit.source: Typically used for commands.
trans-unit.target: Typically used for commands.

trans-unit.source: Occlusion tooltip (for actions) 200 ms Yes Rich tooltip ~2000 ms No For slower, more deliberate exploration and learning.
trans-unit.target: Occlusion tooltip (for actions) 200 ms Yes Rich tooltip ~2000 ms No For slower, more deliberate exploration and learning.

trans-unit.source: Typically used with collection items.
trans-unit.target: Typically used with collection items.

trans-unit.source: Self-revealing interaction ~2000 ms No Context menu ~2000 ms No Exposes a limited set of commands related to the selected object.
trans-unit.target: Self-revealing interaction ~2000 ms No Context menu ~2000 ms No Exposes a limited set of commands related to the selected object.

trans-unit.source: Flyouts ~2000 ms No Exposes a limited set of commands related to the selected object.
trans-unit.target: Flyouts ~2000 ms No Exposes a limited set of commands related to the selected object.

trans-unit.source: For more info on providing informational UI, see [Laying out your UI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465304) and [Displaying popups](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh738362).
trans-unit.target: For more info on providing informational UI, see [Laying out your UI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465304) and [Displaying popups](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh738362).

trans-unit.source: Tooltips
trans-unit.target: Tooltips

trans-unit.source: Use tooltips to reveal more information about a control before asking the user to perform an action.
trans-unit.target: Use tooltips to reveal more information about a control before asking the user to perform an action.

trans-unit.source: Tooltips ([**Tooltip**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229763)) appear automatically when a user performs a press and hold gesture (or a hover event is detected) on a control or object.
trans-unit.target: Tooltips ([**Tooltip**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229763)) appear automatically when a user performs a press and hold gesture (or a hover event is detected) on a control or object.

trans-unit.source: The tooltip disappears when the contact or cursor moves off the control or object.
trans-unit.target: The tooltip disappears when the contact or cursor moves off the control or object.

trans-unit.source: A tooltip can include text and images, but is not interactive.
trans-unit.target: A tooltip can include text and images, but is not interactive.

trans-unit.source: Occlusion tooltips for small targets
trans-unit.target: Occlusion tooltips for small targets

trans-unit.source: Occlusion tooltips describe the occluded target.
trans-unit.target: Occlusion tooltips describe the occluded target.

trans-unit.source: These tooltips are useful when targeting and activating items smaller than a standard touch target size, such as hyperlinks on a webpage.
trans-unit.target: These tooltips are useful when targeting and activating items smaller than a standard touch target size, such as hyperlinks on a webpage.

trans-unit.source: You can replace these tooltips with an informational pop-up after a certain time threshold has passed.
trans-unit.target: You can replace these tooltips with an informational pop-up after a certain time threshold has passed.

trans-unit.source: For example, use an occlusion tooltip to show the occluded text of the hyperlink and then replace the tooltip with a pop-up containing the URL.
trans-unit.target: For example, use an occlusion tooltip to show the occluded text of the hyperlink and then replace the tooltip with a pop-up containing the URL.

trans-unit.source: Occlusion tooltips for actions and commands
trans-unit.target: Occlusion tooltips for actions and commands

trans-unit.source: These tooltips describe the action or command that occurs when a user lifts their finger from an element.
trans-unit.target: These tooltips describe the action or command that occurs when a user lifts their finger from an element.

trans-unit.source: These tooltips are useful when targeting and activating a button or similar control.
trans-unit.target: These tooltips are useful when targeting and activating a button or similar control.

trans-unit.source: A small-target tooltip can be followed by an action tooltip after a certain time threshold has passed.
trans-unit.target: A small-target tooltip can be followed by an action tooltip after a certain time threshold has passed.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the small-target tooltip should expand to include the additional info in the action tooltip.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the small-target tooltip should expand to include the additional info in the action tooltip.

trans-unit.source: Rich tooltip
trans-unit.target: Rich tooltip

trans-unit.source: These tooltips reveal secondary info about an element.
trans-unit.target: These tooltips reveal secondary info about an element.

trans-unit.source: For example, a rich tooltip could be a text description of an image, the full text of a truncated title, or other info relevant to the target.
trans-unit.target: For example, a rich tooltip could be a text description of an image, the full text of a truncated title, or other info relevant to the target.

trans-unit.source: Rich tooltips typically contain info that doesn't need to be made available immediately and, in some cases, might be distracting if shown too quickly.
trans-unit.target: Rich tooltips typically contain info that doesn't need to be made available immediately and, in some cases, might be distracting if shown too quickly.

trans-unit.source: A longer time threshold lets users be more deliberate about obtaining the info.
trans-unit.target: A longer time threshold lets users be more deliberate about obtaining the info.

trans-unit.source: After a rich tooltip is displayed, the object is no longer activated when the user lifts their finger.
trans-unit.target: After a rich tooltip is displayed, the object is no longer activated when the user lifts their finger.

trans-unit.source: The reason for this is that info gleaned from the tooltip might influence the user to not to activate the item.
trans-unit.target: The reason for this is that info gleaned from the tooltip might influence the user to not to activate the item.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that the visual design and info in the rich tooltip be distinct and more substantial than that of a standard tooltip.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that the visual design and info in the rich tooltip be distinct and more substantial than that of a standard tooltip.

trans-unit.source: Context menu
trans-unit.target: Context menu

trans-unit.source: The context menu ([**PopupMenu**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208693)) is a lightweight menu that gives users immediate access to actions (like clipboard commands) on text or UI objects in Windows Store apps.
trans-unit.target: The context menu ([**PopupMenu**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208693)) is a lightweight menu that gives users immediate access to actions (like clipboard commands) on text or UI objects in Windows Store apps.

trans-unit.source: The touch-optimized context menu consists of two parts.
trans-unit.target: The touch-optimized context menu consists of two parts.

trans-unit.source: A visual cue, the hint, is displayed as a result of a hold interaction.
trans-unit.target: A visual cue, the hint, is displayed as a result of a hold interaction.

trans-unit.source: Then, the context menu itself is displayed after the hint disappears and the user lifts their finger.
trans-unit.target: Then, the context menu itself is displayed after the hint disappears and the user lifts their finger.

trans-unit.source: The following images demonstrate how to invoke the default context menu for text by tapping within a selection or on a gripper (press and hold can also be used).
trans-unit.target: The following images demonstrate how to invoke the default context menu for text by tapping within a selection or on a gripper (press and hold can also be used).

trans-unit.source: tap (or press and hold) within the selection or on a gripper to invoke the context menu.
trans-unit.target: tap (or press and hold) within the selection or on a gripper to invoke the context menu.

trans-unit.source: See [Adding context menus](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465300).
trans-unit.target: See [Adding context menus](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465300).

trans-unit.source: Message dialog
trans-unit.target: Message dialog

trans-unit.source: Use message dialogs ([**MessageDialog**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208674)) to prompt users for a response, based on user action or app state, before continuing.
trans-unit.target: Use message dialogs ([**MessageDialog**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208674)) to prompt users for a response, based on user action or app state, before continuing.

trans-unit.source: Explicit user interaction is required and input to the app is blocked until the user responds.
trans-unit.target: Explicit user interaction is required and input to the app is blocked until the user responds.

trans-unit.source: message dialog for an error message
trans-unit.target: message dialog for an error message

trans-unit.source: Here are some typical reasons to display a message dialog.
trans-unit.target: Here are some typical reasons to display a message dialog.

trans-unit.source: Present urgent information
trans-unit.target: Present urgent information

trans-unit.source: Ask a question before continuing execution
trans-unit.target: Ask a question before continuing execution

trans-unit.source: Display error messages
trans-unit.target: Display error messages

trans-unit.source: See [Adding message dialogs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh738361).
trans-unit.target: See [Adding message dialogs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh738361).

trans-unit.source: Flyout
trans-unit.target: Flyout

trans-unit.source: A flyout ([**Flyout**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211726)) is a lightweight UI panel displayed on a tap, click, or other activation that is used to present the user with information, questions, or a menu of options related to the current activity.
trans-unit.target: A flyout ([**Flyout**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211726)) is a lightweight UI panel displayed on a tap, click, or other activation that is used to present the user with information, questions, or a menu of options related to the current activity.

trans-unit.source: It can be light dismissed (it disappears when the user touches or clicks outside the flyout panel or presses ESC).
trans-unit.target: It can be light dismissed (it disappears when the user touches or clicks outside the flyout panel or presses ESC).

trans-unit.source: In other words, a flyout can be ignored.
trans-unit.target: In other words, a flyout can be ignored.

trans-unit.source: Unlike tooltips, flyouts can accept input.
trans-unit.target: Unlike tooltips, flyouts can accept input.

trans-unit.source: Unlike message dialogs, the app is still active and accepting input.
trans-unit.target: Unlike message dialogs, the app is still active and accepting input.

trans-unit.source: flyout with confirmation
trans-unit.target: flyout with confirmation

trans-unit.source: See [Adding Flyouts and menus](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465325).
trans-unit.target: See [Adding Flyouts and menus](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465325).

trans-unit.source: Self-revealing UI
trans-unit.target: Self-revealing UI

trans-unit.source: A self-revealing interaction is an informative visual cue or animation that demonstrates how to perform an action with a target object and provides a preview of the result of that action.
trans-unit.target: A self-revealing interaction is an informative visual cue or animation that demonstrates how to perform an action with a target object and provides a preview of the result of that action.

trans-unit.source: These next few images show the self-revealing interaction for a cross-slide selection on the Start screen.
trans-unit.target: These next few images show the self-revealing interaction for a cross-slide selection on the Start screen.

trans-unit.source: When a user touches an app tile (without dragging the tile) the tile slides down (as if being dragged) to reveal the selection check mark that would appear if the app were actually selected.
trans-unit.target: When a user touches an app tile (without dragging the tile) the tile slides down (as if being dragged) to reveal the selection check mark that would appear if the app were actually selected.

trans-unit.source: screen shot showing an unselected state.
trans-unit.target: screen shot showing an unselected state.

trans-unit.source: Press finger down on an item to start the self-revealing interaction for selection.
trans-unit.target: Press finger down on an item to start the self-revealing interaction for selection.

trans-unit.source: The self-revealing interaction demonstrates what action will be performed on the item.
trans-unit.target: The self-revealing interaction demonstrates what action will be performed on the item.

trans-unit.source: screen shot showing the animation for selection.
trans-unit.target: screen shot showing the animation for selection.

trans-unit.source: Without lifting the finger, swipe to actually select the item.
trans-unit.target: Without lifting the finger, swipe to actually select the item.

trans-unit.source: screen shot showing the animation for drag and drop.
trans-unit.target: screen shot showing the animation for drag and drop.

trans-unit.source: If the user continues to slide their finger, the self-revealing visualization changes to show that the object can now be moved.
trans-unit.target: If the user continues to slide their finger, the self-revealing visualization changes to show that the object can now be moved.

trans-unit.source: After a self-revealing interaction is displayed, the object is no longer activated when the user lifts their finger.
trans-unit.target: After a self-revealing interaction is displayed, the object is no longer activated when the user lifts their finger.
